name: Wtframework
tagline: Framework for structured Web Tests in Python.
body:
### Welcome to Wtframework.
The easy way to organize your web tests.  WTF aims to be the glue that holds together all the open source pieces needed to test a Web App in Python.

Installation
=======

Requirements
*	Python 2.7 - http://www.python.org/download/
*	PyPi (pip) - http://www.pip-installer.org/en/latest/

Installation via PYPI

	pip install wtframework

See installation instructions, https://github.com/wiredrive/wtframework/wiki/Installation-Guide

Additional Downloads
========
Chrome PageObject Utility - [Download](https://github.com/wiredrive/wtframework/blob/gh-pages/browser_plugins/chrome/dist/wtf_page_mapper.zip?raw=true)

### Authors and Contributors
David Lai (@dlai0001)

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with WTF? Check out the documentation at https://github.com/wiredrive/wtframework/wiki or post a question to our Issues tracker, https://github.com/wiredrive/wtframework/issues.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
